column5: Wow!  According to the Ludington (Michigan) Daily News, some guy caught a 41 pound, 7 ounce brown in the Manistee River. It's a pending world record.  www.ludingtondailynews.com/news.php?story_id=45793
What a beast. Hopefully we'll soon see some pictures.
This pic was posted along with the story on another board...though I can't confirm if it is actually the fish in question. (regardless, this one is a monster!)
Look at the size of that thing!!  lol
just slightly larger then the 12" browns i'm used to catching.
This pic is now rotating on the Ludington newspaper website home page  (www.ludingtondailynews.com).

Legend  I'm hoping one day I'll get into a fish that size  I remember reading an article saying that the Seeforellen strain of brown trout (which were stocked in the great lakes) could possibly reach weights of over 50lbs
Looks like the same fish...a big hen, worn lower caudal fin.
Let me be the first to say....ATLANTIC!!!! LOL
thats things is huge, sucks it has to die though...
thats worthy of a record!!!  impressive!!!  isnt it a worn out Chinook...cant be an atlantic...
WOW   MONSTER brown The guy must of had the fight of his life with that beast.... Leechman

Amazing, thanks for posting that. What's even more incredible to me is that it was caught in the river. They don't usually start to show up in numbers 'till a bit later. With the warm temps it must have been a battle.
Big deal, he didn't catch it on a fly.   Oh... is that sour grapes?   What a pig.   What do you suppose that guy on the left is doing in that first picture?
He's looking at the lure and realizing the lip is broken and it wasn't running right!!!  :D
I think he's sick with envy...tossing a few cookies over the side...
He is trying to get the gill net back in the water so nobody sees it.
